Trial_Design.evidence: We compared patients with and without postoperative AKI within 30 days of open surgery for gynecologic malignancies using ERAS protocols from March 2016-December 2018 at a single academic institution.

Participants.evidence: patients who did and did not develop acute kidney injury (AKI) after open ERAS surgery for gynecologic malignancy.

Intervention.evidence: We compared patients with and without postoperative AKI

Objective.evidence: To compare development of long-term chronic kidney disease (CKD) and cardiac conditions postoperatively among patients who did and did not develop acute kidney injury (AKI) after open ERAS surgery for gynecologic malignancy.

Method_Outcome.evidence: We estimated 36-month cumulative incidence of renal and cardiac conditions for each cohort.

Result_Outcome.evidence: patients with AKI were more likely to develop CKD (HR=2.17, 95% CI 1.22â€“3.84)
